resource.chars:
the whole of its known range.
The subjects of the plates are not always selected from specimens from the same 
place (see fig 10 & fig 11), also figs 
34 & 35 which are stated to come
from islands of the same group, one 
of them being in the Fiji & the other 
in the Loyalty groups.
I do not consider that the subject 
of this paper is sufficiently novel or 
that it has been treated in so 
exhaustive or careful manner as 
to render it desirable that the paper 
should be published in the Societies 
Transactions or Proceedings I am yrs faithfully 
Osbert Salvin
